headline: A Dave Ramsey Caller Is Losing His High-Paying Job In December, Yet He's In A Position Most People Dream Of. 'This Is Just An Inconvenience'
summary: On a recent episode of “The Ramsey Show,” a caller named Michael from Boston shared that he's about to lose his $160,000-a-year job in product management and a 20% annual bonus. His company is letting him go at the end of the year. Normally, this kind of news would send a household into panic mode, especially in today’s economy. A Wave Of Layoffs Is Hitting Corporate America Mass layoffs have been making headlines across the U.S. Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN), United Parcel Service (NYSE:UPS) and Intel (

headline: A ‘jobless profit boom’ has cemented a permanent loss in payrolls as AI displaces labor at a faster rate, strategist says
summary: "We suspect that job losses in tech have been driven mainly by AI displacement."

headline: Is Salesforce Still a Bargain After AI Initiatives and Recent Price Swings?
summary: Curious whether Salesforce could be a bargain or if it is too expensive right now? You are not alone, as many investors are re-examining the stock's value amid recent market swings. Salesforce shares have gained 1.9% over the last week and 8.3% in the past month, but they are still down 21.2% year-to-date and 12.1% over the last year, showing just how swiftly sentiment can change. Much of this movement has come on the heels of Salesforce's bold new AI initiatives and high-profile strategic...

headline: Why the Goldman Sachs CEO isn’t buying the AI jobs freakout
summary: The fingerprints of artificial intelligence are all over mass layoffs and downsizing at Meta, Amazon, Salesforce, YouTube and other major companies, raising fears of an AI-fueled jobs wipeout for white-collar workers.
